intro: Nasonia ionanthera, commonly known as the mountain nasonia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically finely divided, giving it a delicate appearance. Nasonia ionanthera is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cooler, high-altitude environments.
